Description.val:
The Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) Protection Kit program provides Armor Survivability Suite protection.  HTV Protection Kits include B-Kits (with underbody protection), Fire Suppression, Fuel Tank Fire Suppression (FTFS) Blanket , Fuel Tank Self Sealant (FTSS), and Tank Armor Module (TAM) to enhance survivability.  The Armor Survivability Suite components are mounted to an A-Kit Heavy Tactical Vehicle; which includes Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck (HEMTT), Heavy Equipment Transporter System (HET), Palletized Load System (PLS), Heavy Dump Truck (HDT), and Line Haul configurations to address numerous threats that the Department of Defense has identified.  The Armor Survivability Suite provides occupant protection through enhanced tactical vehicle ballistic protection. The Army Procurement Objective (APO) for Heavy Tactical Vehicles (HTV) is 12,860.
.

The Medium Tactical Vehicles (MTV) Protection Kit Suite includes an Armor Kit and a Fuel Tank Fire Suppression (FTFS) system. The Armor Kit consists of applique armor panels that are mounted to the FMTV A-Cab exterior to further improve occupant survivability from attack. The FTFS is a ballistic fire protection system designed to cover the fuel tank on the LTAS FMTV. The MTV Protection Kit Suite provides occupant protection through enhanced tactical vehicle ballistic protection. ISO containers are inclusive to facilitate long term storage.  The Army Procurement Objective (APO) for Medium Tactical Vehicles (MTV) is 17,752.

Protection kits were previously part of DA0500 (Family of Heavy Tactical Vehicles) and D15500 (Family of Medium Tactical Vehicles).

Justification.val:
FY 2018 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $43.040 million procures 422 Armor Survivability Suite Protection Kits for Heavy Tactical Vehicles and 392 Protection Kits for Medium Tactical Vehicles to support Active Army units.

This procurement will bring the Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) and Medium Tactical Vehicle (MTV) fleets much closer to the Army Tactical Wheeled Vehicle (TWV) strategy of 30% armor kits on hand and gives the Army greater flexibility to react to a contingency with the knowledge that Soldiers will have the best protection available.

System Engineering/Program Management (SEPM) includes Program Management and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and provide contractor oversight.  Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training, and other government costs are included for retaining a professional acquisition workforce.  

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
FY17 is the last ordering year for Ibis Tek. A follow on contract is to be determined upon completion of competitive bid process with target award date of Mar 2018.

Production rates and lead times are estimated until new contract award.

May 2017 is the last ordering year for Fidelity Technologies.  A follow on contract is to be determined upon completion of competitive bid process with a target award date of June 2018.  Remaining FY17 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) funding and FY18 Base funding will be awarded on this new contract.

Production rates and lead times are estimated until new contract award.

Fluctuation in unit cost is caused by model mix.

FY17 funding escalation is due to Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) funding received.

OverallDeliveryScheduleRemarks.val: The ALT/PLT will be determined after contract award.
